qas.question: Which Carnival in Argentina is the most representative of the nature of the Carnival?
What city in the east of Entre Rios province is considered the most important one for the Carnival?
What kind of tradition does the city of Corrientes have?

answers.text: In all major cities and many towns throughout the country

context: In Argentina, the most representative Carnival performed is the so-called <a0_0>Murga<a0_0/>, although other famous Carnivals, more like Brazil's, are held in Argentine Mesopotamia and the North-East. <a1_0>Gualeguaychú<a1_0/> in the east of Entre Ríos province is the most important Carnival city and has one of the largest parades. It adopts a musical background similar to Brazilian or Uruguayan Carnival. Corrientes is another city with a <a2_0>Carnival<a2_0/> tradition. Chamame is a <a3_0>popular musical style.<a3_0/> <a4_0>In all major cities and many towns throughout the country<a4_0/>, Carnival is celebrated.
